projects.description: VirtuoCart is a web app I created, inspired by my father who is a photographer, to help artists advertise their work using Augmented Reality. Artists can upload their 2D images to VirtuoCart and a Blender Python script on the backend will generate a framed 3D model in the AR friendly GLB format. VirtuoCart also provides the code to embed an AR viewer into the artists website.

Minecraft at Home is my final project for my Computer Graphics class at Princeton University. Our game uses ThreeJS to render a procedurally generated 3D block world that the player can interact with by placing and destroying blocks. This project helped me learn a lot about optimization, since rendering thousands of blocks is an insanely pefromance intensive task!

TigerLaunch is the nation's largest student-run entrepreneurship competition. I was the lead developer for the application judging system, which is used by over 50 VC judges to review and score applications. I used ReactJS to create a dynamic web app that allows judges to view and score applications, and I used Firebase to store and manage the data. I also used the Google Maps API to automatically sort applicants to their closest regional, a task that was previously done manually.
